pullRequest.title: Implement feature for mods to define new world types
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR overlaps with #7353. I realized that other PR exists, after I already had written this code.
Unlike 7353, this PR does not attempt to implement any stock GUI for level-type options, nor does it wrap nor allow customizing of the vanilla world types, I considered those to be out of the scope of my idea.

nodes.bodyText: The customization screens need a way of sending the modified DimensionGeneratorSettings back to the WorldOptionsScreen. The built-in BiomeGeneratorTypeScreens use WorldOptionsScreen::func_239043_a_ which has protected access (I just AT'd it in my PR)

afterCommit.message:
Implement feature for mods to define new world types and their corresponding settings screens.
* Add ability to change the default world type.
  * Mods can propose defaults, but they have no final say in which one gets picked.
  * The default world type configurable via forge config, so users have the final say.
  * When not configured, the logic will use whatever the last proposed world type may be.

nodes.bodyText:
Might I suggest a rewording of this, to avoid the doubled-up "default" word?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                                .comment("Defines a default world type to use instead of the vanilla 'default' default.")
          
          
            
                                .comment("Defines a default world type to use. The vanilla default world type is represented by 'default'.")

Would it be worth noting in the comment that modded world-types must be specified with a namespace? Modders will need to relay that information anyway (for server.properties) but there could still be confusion since "default" isn't prefixed with "minecraft:"
